0.name: My Sword Zaps Demons
0.fullDesc: Deals Imaginary DMG equal to <orangeStrong>{{1, percent}}%</orangeStrong> of March 7th's ATK to a single target enemy and gains {{2}} point(s) of Charge.
0.shortDesc: Deals minor Imaginary DMG to a single enemy and gains <orangeStrong>{{2}}</orangeStrong> point(s) of Charge.

1.name: Brows Be Smitten, Heart Be Bitten
1.fullDesc:
Initially, deals {{4}} hits, each causing Imaginary DMG equal to {{1, percent}}% of March 7th's ATK to a single target enemy. Whenever dealing the final hit, there is a {{2, percent}}% fixed chance to deal 1 additional hit of DMG, up to a max of {{3}} additional hit(s). Energy regenerated from using Enhanced Basic ATK does not increase with the number of hits.
Enhanced Basic ATK cannot recover Skill Points.
1.shortDesc: Deals Imaginary DMG to a single enemy, dealing <orangeStrong>{{4}}</orangeStrong> hits initially. <orangeStrong>There is a chance to additionally deal up to <unbreak>{{3}}[i]</orangeStrong> hit(s)</color>.

0.name: Master, It's Tea Time!
0.fullDesc:
Designates a single ally (excluding this unit) as "Shifu" and increases "Shifu"'s SPD by {{1, percent(fixed: 1)}}%. Only the most recent target of March 7th's Skill is considered as "Shifu."


Whenever using Basic ATK or dealing 1 hit of Enhanced Basic ATK's DMG, triggers the corresponding effect if "Shifu" with the specified Path is present on the field:

Erudition, Destruction, The Hunt, Remembrance: Deals Additional DMG (DMG Type based on "Shifu"'s Combat Type) equal to {{2, percent}}% of March 7th's ATK.

Harmony, Nihility, Preservation, Abundance: Increases the Toughness Reduction of this instance of DMG by {{3, percent}}%.
0.shortDesc:
Makes a single ally become "Shifu." When using Basic ATK or dealing Enhanced Basic ATK's DMG, triggers the corresponding effect based on the "Shifu"'s Path:
Erudition, Destruction, The Hunt, Remembrance: Deals Additional DMG based on Shifu's Type.
Harmony, Nihility, Preservation, Abundance: Toughness Reduction increases.

0.name: March 7th, the Apex Heroine
0.fullDesc:
Deals Imaginary DMG equal to {{1, percent}}% of March 7th's ATK to a single target enemy.
Increases the initial Hits Per Action of the next Enhanced Basic ATK by {{2}} hits and increase the fixed chance of additionally dealing DMG by {{3, percent}}%.
0.shortDesc: Deals Imaginary DMG to a single enemy and <orangeStrong>increases</orangeStrong> the Hits Per Action and DMG chance of <orangeStrong>the next Enhanced Basic ATK</orangeStrong>.

0.name: Master, I've Ascended!
0.fullDesc:
After Shifu uses an attack or Ultimate, March 7th gains up to 1 point of Charge each time.
Upon reaching {{1}} or more points of Charge, March 7th immediately takes action and increases the DMG she deals by {{2, percent}}%. Her Basic ATK gets Enhanced, and her Skill cannot be used. After using Enhanced Basic ATK, consumes {{1}} point(s) of Charge. Charge is capped at {{3}} points.
0.shortDesc: After <orangeStrong>Shifu uses an attack or Ultimate</orangeStrong>, March 7th gains Charge. When reaching <orangeStrong>{{1}}</orangeStrong> points of Charge, March 7th immediately takes action and increases the DMG she deals. <orangeStrong>Basic ATK gets Enhanced</orangeStrong>.

0.name: Feast in One Go
0.fullDesc:
If March 7th is on the team, she gains 1 point of Charge at the start of the next battle whenever a teammate uses Technique, up to a max of {{1}} point(s).
After using Technique, March 7th regenerates {{2}} Energy when the next battle starts.
0.shortDesc: Whenever a teammate uses Technique, March 7th gains Charge upon entering the next battle. Using Technique regenerates Energy upon entering the next battle.

2.name: Blade Dances on Waves' Fight
2.desc: After "Shifu" uses Basic ATK or Skill to attack an enemy target, March 7th immediately launches a Follow-up ATK and deals Imaginary DMG equal to {{1, percent}}% of March 7th's ATK to the primary target of this attack. Additionally, triggers the corresponding effect based on "Shifu"'s Path and then gains {{3}} point(s) of Charge. If there is no primary target available to attack, then she attacks a single random enemy instead. This effect can only trigger once per turn.
